head.title: Full Public Financing For Diverse Candidates

hedline.hl1: Full Public Financing For Diverse Candidates

block.p: In reforming New York State's scandalous campaign finance system (''Time for Spring Cleaning,'' editorial, April 22), why not offer candidates and voters the voluntary alternative of full public financing?

In reforming New York State's scandalous campaign finance system (''Time for Spring Cleaning,'' editorial, April 22), why not offer candidates and voters the voluntary alternative of full public financing?

Under this system, a candidate qualifies by demonstrating community support in the form of very small contributions, and thereafter is free from the pressure to raise big money from interests seeking influence.

Full public financing broadens the pool of candidates beyond the wealthy and well connected, promoting diversity and competition. It's working in Arizona and Maine, and would go a long way toward opening up and cleaning up the broken political process in Albany.
